import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder, StandardScaler
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor, GradientBoostingRegressor
from xgboost import XGBRegressor
from lightgbm import LGBMRegressor
from catboost import CatBoostRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error, r2_score
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
validation = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Drop Id from train and test
train = train.drop(columns=['Id'])
test = test.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Handle missing values
# Fill missing values with median for numeric, mode for categorical
numeric_columns = train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
categorical_columns = train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns

# Fill missing numeric values with median
train[numeric_columns] = train[numeric_columns].fillna(train[numeric_columns].median())
test[numeric_columns] = test[numeric_columns].fillna(test[numeric_columns].median())

# Fill missing categorical values with mode
train[categorical_columns] = train[categorical_columns].fillna(train[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])
test[categorical_columns] = test[categorical_columns].fillna(test[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])

# Feature engineering
# Create new features
train['Age'] = train['YrSold'] - train['YearBuilt']
train['RemodAge'] = train['YrSold'] - train['YearRemodAdd']
train['TotalSF'] = train['1stFlrSF'] + train['2ndFlrSF'] + train['LowQualFinSF'] + train['GrLivArea']
train['TotalBsmtSF'] = train['TotalBsmtSF'].fillna(train['TotalBsmtSF'].median())
train['BsmtFinSF'] = train['BsmtFinSF1'] + train['BsmtFinSF2']
train['GarageArea'] = train['GarageArea'].fillna(t

from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline

# Load data

test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

test = test.drop(columns=['Id'])

test[categorical_columns] = test[categorical_columns].fillna(test[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder, StandardScaler
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline

test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

test = test.drop(columns=['Id'])

X['HasGarage'] = (X['GarageArea'] > 0).astype(int)

X['HasFireplace'] = (X['Fireplaces'] > 0).astype(int)
